text: Hurricane Ginger is the second longest-lasting Atlantic hurricane on record. It started September 6, 1971 and lasted until October 5. The storm struck eastern North Carolina on September 30, causing $10 million in damage. Peak winds were 110 miles per hour during Ginger's life. Category:1970s in weather Category:1971 in the United States Category:Category 2 Atlantic hurricanes Category:Hurricanes in North Carolina
title: Hurricane Ginger
